title: Simon Property Group 3Q Profit Slips, Revenue Edges Up
text:
By Dave Sebastian

Simon Property Group Inc. (SPG) reported a slightly lower third-quarter profit and funds from operations as revenue ticked up.

For the quarter ended Sept. 30, the Indianapolis-based mall owner posted net income of $544.3 million, or $1.77 a share, compared with $556.3 million, or $1.80 a share, in the same quarter last year. Analysts polled by FactSet were looking for $1.75 a share.

The company's funds from operations, a profit metric used by real-estate-investment trusts that excludes costs like depreciation, came in at $1.08 billion, or $3.05 a share, compared with $1.09 billion, or $3.05 a share, in the prior year. Analysts were expecting $3.06 a share.

Revenue rose to $1.42 billion from $1.4 billion a year earlier. Analysts were expecting $1.32 billion.

The company said occupancy was 94.7% on Sept. 30.

Write to Dave Sebastian at dave.sebastian@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 07:35 ET (11:35 GMT)
